body_html:
@vipinpillai Yes, understood the issue, which is why I said to leverage tf.image.image_gradients only to get some implementation ideas. There are other alternatives as well. Previously executed the code you provided inside the issue without running into error, which is different from the zip file.
Absolutely, images used as 4D tensor is standard practice, but feeding into tf.gradients directly is a different story. Please refer to tf.gradients..

body:
@vipinpillai Yes, understood the issue, which is why I said to leverage  `tf.image.image_gradients` only to get some implementation ideas. There are other alternatives as well. Previously executed the code you provided inside the issue without running into error, which is different from the zip file. 
Absolutely, images used as 4D tensor is standard practice, but feeding into tf.gradients directly is a different story. Please refer to [`tf.gradients`.](https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/gradients).
